00016 typedef struct
00017 {
00018       //These are the mandatory entry points for a map.  If any of the values are -1, then that means that
00019       //the point has been specifically not used and that the map is not traversable to or from an adjacent 
00020       //sector in that direction.  The >0 value points must be validated before saving the map.  This is 
00021       //done by simply checking if those points are sittable by mercs, and that you can plot a path from 
00022       //these points to each other.  These values can only be set by the editor : mapinfo tab
00023   INT16 sNorthGridNo;
00024       INT16 sEastGridNo;
00025       INT16 sSouthGridNo;
00026       INT16 sWestGridNo;
00027       //This contains the number of individuals in the map.
00028       //Individuals include NPCs, enemy placements, creatures, civilians, rebels, and animals.
00029       UINT8 ubNumIndividuals;
00030       UINT8 ubMapVersion;
00031       UINT8 ubRestrictedScrollID;
00032       UINT8 ubEditorSmoothingType;  //normal, basement, or caves
00033       INT16 sCenterGridNo;
00034       INT16 sIsolatedGridNo;
00035       INT8 bPadding[83];      //I'm sure lots of map info will be added
00036 }MAPCREATE_STRUCT; //99 bytes
